description.narrative:
This initiative covers activities relating to the AusAID-World Bank PFM partnership.
At the moment these include:
1) Strengthening support in the area of Public Investment Management (PIM). To help consolidate international learning in this area, the WB in collaboration with KDI and AusAID is planning to publish an international volume, "Promoting Public Investment Efficiency: International Experience". The volume is expected to contain 7 cross-cutting chapters and 16 summary country cases. Support from AusAid will allow for (i) supplementary review of relevant developed country settings with decentralized PIM settings (Australia, Germany), (ii) elaboration of additional issues raised by the Hanoi conference participants, (iii) a wrap-up review/consultation of the PIM volume and its operational implications anticipated for the second week of Feb 2011, (iv) coordination to support participation of AusAid staff around in country PIM dialogues, (v) initiation of a wider dialogue
